page.title: 05BEEF FARMING IN GREENMOUNT
page.content: {Beef-farming}is carried out at Tower Farm in Greenmount. It was built in 1840 by Joshua Knowles for stabling the horses which hauled cartloads of cotton from his nearby mill. For the past twenty two years it has been owned by Mr.V.Chadwick and is a beef farm unlike many dairy farms in the area. There are also 59 ewes served by 3 rams and this year 104 lambs were born. Mr Chadwick has 100 acres of land, some of it rented and he produces enough hay for winter feeding. Mr Chadwick uses markets at Preston,Clitheroe,Haslingden and Blackburn, depending where he can get the best price for his animals. There are 14{stables}rented out to horse owners and there are 3 working dogs on the farm.{Vandalism}is a problem with animals being injured.
